page.title: 08Shopping in Melchbourne
page.content: Melchbournd does not have any shops, but even so, there is no necessity to leave the village to get the weekly shopping. Meat can be bought from the mobile butcher from Rushden or an order telephoned to the butcher in Kimbolton guarantees a meat delivery twice a week. A fishman calls on a weekly basis. Bread and groceries are available from the bakery at Dean who deliver twice a week to the village. There is also a mobile shop that calls twice a week. Vegetables can be bought from a gentleman in the village. The milkman also provides more than just dairy produce. He also brings eggs, potatoes, fruit juices, chickens and other grocery items. Library books can be exchanged once a fortnight on the mobile library.
